content:
I understand what you mean, thank you for pointing that out. The terminology I used can be confusing.

A more appropriate way to phrase it would be:
A writing system represents the concepts of a linguistic system in a written form and a spoken language represents the concepts of a linguistic system in an auditory form.

Where "linguistic system" refers to the set of concepts, grammar, and vocabulary that make up a language and "writing system" and "spoken language" refer to the means of representation, which are either written or spoken.

I apologize for any confusion my previous answers may have caused, and I will make sure to be more precise with my terminology in the future.
